results.title: The Vice President
results.creator_credit: Hugh O'Connor, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
Elevation to the position of Vice-President brings prestige responsibility and freedoms of action, but it also means a shifting of loyalties and the losing of personal contact. This is shown in the dramatised story of John Harvard who rising from Branch Director to Vice-President finds himself having to put pressure on the men who a short time ago were his near equals. Only by going against their wishes can he serve the best interests of his company.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hugh O’Connor, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Vic Greenaway: production potter
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon, Nina Syme and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Vic Greenaway is an accomplished potter with his ceramic workshop set in the cournty where he works with two apprentices. Pottery for him is a lifetime work, a total commitment requiring all his energies and concentration.

results.title: Verdict at 1.32
results.creator_credit: Charles Davis, Burt Martin and International Temperance Society
results.brief_description: Dramatically depicts the effects of alcohol, stressing that consuming even the smallest quantities of alcohol can be dangerous. Tells the story of a young secretary who has two cocktails while out to lunch with her fiance. Her reaction dulled when driving back to work, she cannot brake in time and is killed, killing another person, also an alcoholic. Subsequently both their brains are examined by a neurologist; and the effects of alcohol on reaction times and normal co-ordination, convincingly demonstrated at a physiology lecture and a sports car gymkhana.

results.title: VD every thirty seconds
results.brief_description: Every thirty seconds someone is infected with a venereal disease. it is more prevalent in the 15-25 year old group. Points out the ways in which one contracts these diseases and various treatments with emphasis on the importance of prompt medical attention in suspected cases.
results.description: Every thirty seconds someone is infected with a venereal disease. it is more prevalent in the 15-25 year old group. Points out the ways in which one contracts these diseases and various treatments with emphasis on the importance of prompt medical attention in suspected cases.

results.title: VD: don't take the risk
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”
Statistics show that venereal disease rates are rising, particularly among teenagers; teenagers explain how they become affected, and later describe their experiences in clinics. A lecture, sensibly frank and usefully informative in respect to symptoms, is heard and discussed by a mixed sixth form; a doctor gives further information about the spread of the disease and clinical procedure.
Follow-up to previous Granada program “The Shadow of ignorance: an inquiry”.

results.title: VD: a new focus
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck, American Educational Films and Directions Unlimited Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Traces the history of venereal diseases, points out the reasons why there is no vaccine for treatment and lists the symptoms of venereal disease. Emphasises the case and importance of cure in the early stages. Exposes myths surrounding venereal diseases.

results.title: Vanadium: a transition element
results.creator_credit: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Eipsode of Series “Chemical Education Material Study”
Vanadium is studied as a typical transition element. The different oxidation states of vanadium and their colours are observed and then identified by means of a quantitative titration of vanadium(II) solution with cerium(IV) solution. The oxidation states and the observed colours are correlated with the electronic structures using an orbital board. The formation of complex ions containing vanadium in different oxidation states is demonstrated. The variations in properties in terms of ion size and charge density are discussed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J. Arthur Campbell, David W. Ridgway and Wexler Film Productions
